ETYMOLOGY: From Latin inter- ('between') + sectiō ('a cutting'), from secāre ('to cut'). Literally 'a cutting between'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A point, line, or area where two or more things (especially geometric figures, surfaces, or lines) meet or cross.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 两件或多件事物（尤其是几何图形、表面或线条）相遇或交叉的点、线或区域。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The intersection of the two planes forms a straight line.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 两个平面的交线形成一条直线。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A place where two or more roads, streets, or paths meet or cross.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 两条或多条道路、街道或小径相遇或交叉的地方，通常指十字路口。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Turn right at the next intersection.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在下一个十字路口右转。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The act or process of intersecting or of being intersected.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 相交或被相交的行为或过程。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The intersection of different cultures often leads to new ideas and perspectives.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 不同文化的交汇常常带来新的思想和视角。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: the intersection of [set A] and [set B]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun, a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In set theory, the set of all elements that are common to two or more sets.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在集合论中，两个或多个集合共有的所有元素组成的集合。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The intersection of set A and set B is denoted as A ∩ B.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 集合A和集合B的交集表示为A ∩ B。

REGISTER: General, and common in academic or technical contexts, especially mathematics and urban planning.
